text: The Dutchess is the debut studio album by American recording artist Fergie. It was released on September 13, 2006, by A&M; Records and the will.i.am Music Group. Musically, The Dutchess is mainly a hip hop and R&B; album that also has roots in reggae, dance and soul. The name is also a references to Sarah Ferguson, the real Duchess of York. They share a surname and nickname of Fergie. The title had media attention. Three of the album's songs ("London Bridge", "Glamorous", and "Big Girls Don't Cry") reached number one on the Billboard Hot 100. "Fergalicious" and "Clumsy" also reached the top five in the US. ==Reviews== The Dutchess received mixed to positive reviews from music critics. == Track listings == ;Notes * signifies a vocal producer ==Charts and certifications== ===Weekly charts=== Chart Peak position Australian Albums Chart 1 Austrian Albums Chart 17 Belgian Albums Chart (Flanders) 45 Belgian Albums Chart (Wallonia) 63 Canadian Albums Chart 4 Danish Albums Chart 27 Dutch Albums Chart"Dutch Top 100 Albums" 46 French Albums Chart"France Top 200 Albums" 44 German Albums Chart 11 Irish Albums Chart 9 Japanese Albums Chart 3 New Zealand Albums Chart 2 Norwegian Albums Chart 17 Polish Albums Chart 14 Portuguese Albums Chart 25 Spanish Albums Chart 93 Swedish Albums Chart 35 Swiss Albums Chart 11 UK Albums Chart 18 US Billboard 200 2 ;The Dutchess EP Chart (2008) Peak position Sales/shipments US Billboard 200 46 14,466 ===Year-end charts=== Chart (2007) Position Australia (ARIA) 5 Chart (2008) Position Australia (ARIA) 64 ===Certifications=== Country Certification (sales thresholds) Argentina Gold Australia 4× Platinum Brazil Platinum Canada 3× Platinum Denmark Gold Germany Gold Japan Platinum Mexico Gold New Zealand Platinum Poland Platinum Russia 3× Platinum Switzerland Gold United Kingdom Platinum United States 3× Platinum ==References== Category:2006 albums Category:Debut albums Category:Hip hop albums Category:Soul albums Category:R&B; albums
